com.siperian.sif.message.mrm

Class CleansePutRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.siperian.sif.message.SiperianRequest
      • com.siperian.sif.message.mrm.CleansePutRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CleanseDataProvider, SiperianObjectUidProvider, SystemProvider, Serializable

    public class CleansePutRequest
extends SiperianRequest
implements SiperianObjectUidProvider, SystemProvider, CleanseDataProvider
    Represents a request object to update or insert a record into a base or dependent object.

    Use the CleansePutRequest object to perform the stage batch process and load batch process in a single request. The stage batch process transfers data from a landing table to the staging table associated with a specific base object after cleansing the data if cleansing is defined. The load batch process transfers data from a staging table to the corresponding target table or base object in the Hub Store. The CleansePutRequest object does not use the landing and staging tables.

    A mapping links a source column in the landing table with a target column in the staging table and defines data cleansing to perform on the data before the data is saved in the target table. The staging table associated with the mapping determines the base or dependent object to which you want to insert or update a record.

    State Management
    If you enable state management on a base object to which you want to insert or update a record, you can specify the initial state of the record in the HUB_STATE_IND column of the mapping. Use one of the following values in the HUB_STATE_IND column:

    • 1. Indicates that the state is ACTIVE.
    • 0. Indicates that the state is PENDING.
    • -1. Indicates that the state is DELETED.
    Default value is 1 when you insert a new record. When you update a record, you cannot use the HUB_STATE_IND column of the mapping to specify the state change. To change the state of a record, use DeleteRequest, RestoreRequest, or PromotePendingXrefsRequest.

    Filtering Records
    You can filter the record that you want to update or insert into a base object so that no changes are made to the Operational Reference Store (ORS). Use one of the following methods to filter the record:

    • Mapping. Use the Mappings tool in the Hub Console to include a condition that must be true in the mapping before the CleansePutRequest object processes the record.
    • Delta detection. If you enable delta detection on the staging table, the CleansePutRequest object is filtered if the input data does not differ from the existing data.

    Use Case
    You can use the CleansePutRequest object to cleanse a specified record and update or insert it into a base object in a single request. A single request reduces the number of round trips between the client and the MDM Hub and increases the performance.

    Usage Example
    The following example updates a record with the ROWID_OBJECT key 782 and uses the Stage CRM Address mapping:

    CleansePutRequest request = new CleansePutRequest();
    Record record = new Record();
    record.setSiperianObjectUid("MAPPING.Stage CRM Address");
    record.setField( new Field("ADDRESS_ID", "782") );
    record.setField( new Field("ADDRESS_LINE", "123 Main St.") );
    record.setField( new Field("CITY_NAME", "Anytown") );
    record.setField( new Field("LAST_UPDATE_DATE", new Date()) );
    request.setRecord( record );
    CleansePutResponse response = (CleansePutResponse) sipClient.process(request);

    Note: When you use the Enterprise JavaBeans (EJB) protocol, you can use the CleansePutRequest object with other requests as part of a transaction. If any request in the transaction fails, the entire transaction is rolled back.

    Guidelines
    Use the following guidelines when you use the CleansePutRequest object:

    • Both the PutRequest and CleansePutRequest objects process null values. For example, when you do not specify a value for a parameter, the value is set to null. However, the CleansePutRequest object does not process records that do not have a reference in the lookup table.
    • Do not insert a null value into a nonnullable column, such as a unique key column. If you do not specify values for a nonnullable column, the empty fields are set to null.
    • Do not use the CleansePutRequest object to insert or update a read-only column.
    • If the Putable property of a system column is enabled in the MDM Hub, you can use the CleansePutRequest object to insert or update a system column.
    • Use backslash (\) to escape the special characters such as single quotation mark (') or tilde (~) in the CleansePutRequest object.

    See Also:
    CleansePutResponse, CleanseRequest, PutRequest, DeleteRequest, RestoreRequest, PromotePendingXrefsRequest, Serialized Form

    API Pair: CleansePutResponse

    API Group: Data Update/Insert

        public boolean getGenerateSourceKey()
        Gets the status that indicates whether to generate a source key.

        Returns:
        • True to generate a source key if the key is not specified in the record key.
        • False if the source key is specified in the record key.

      • setGenerateSourceKey

        public void setGenerateSourceKey(boolean generateSourceKey)
        Sets the status to indicate whether to generate a source key.

        Parameters:
        generateSourceKey - Indicates whether to generate a source key. Specify true to generate a source if the key is not specified in the record key, or specify false if the source key is specified in the record key. Default is false.
